common_issues.title: Pieces OS Connectivity Issues
common_issues.description: Users reported difficulties connecting to Pieces OS from various platforms, including Docker containers and VS Code extensions. The issues stemmed from networking changes in Pieces OS 11.0.0+, requiring workarounds like manual IP configuration or specific DNS entries. Updates to the VS Code extension and Pieces OS aimed to resolve these connectivity problems.

related_issues.title: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container)
related_issues.text: Seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment (VS Code running remote docker container) ### Software VS Code ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.02 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. I'm having the same problem as this: https://github.com/pieces-app/support/issues/269 Using VS Code project within a docker container and getting this message: > Woops! It seems like you are running VS Code in a remote environment & Pieces for VS Code cannot connect to Pieces OS. Please refer to our documentation on how to resolve this issue. ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ffeb53fd-0787-4bc2-9faf-c5f3d179294b) Pieces OS version: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/640d35af-6106-4717-9269-c51205ff23fb) I followed this guide but with no luck: https://docs.pieces.app/product-highlights-and-benefits/connecting-to-a-remote-pieces-os-instance LAN IP: VS Code settings, pieces custom URL: ![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/aaed7eb8-36e7-49cb-b6e0-84271adb8027) What else can I try? Thanks! ## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: **Key Points Raised:** * User (malanciault) cannot connect to Pieces OS using VSCode extension when running in a remote Docker container. * The error occurs even when no VS Code project is open. * The user provided screenshots of the error messages and their VS Code configuration. **Problems Identified:** * Starting from Pieces OS version 11.0.0, the default listening interface of Pieces Server is changed to loopback for security reasons. This prevents connections from remote clients like Docker containers. * The VSCode extension cannot resolve the `host.docker.internal` address used for communication within Docker. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Robert, a Pieces team member, suggests using the default port (39300) and the IP address of the Pieces OS machine (`http://192.168.0.129:39300`). * Malanciault confirms that this solution does not work. * Robert identifies the issue as a networking change in the latest Pieces OS release. * A patch is developed to allow Pieces Server to listen on all interfaces. * As a temporary workaround, Robert suggests creating a DNS entry for `pieceshost` and configuring it to resolve to `host.docker.internal` within the container and to `localhost` outside the container. * Version 2.0.1 of the VSCode extension is released with a fix for this issue. **Current Status/Outcome:** * Malanciault confirms that the issue persists even after updating the plugin. * Robert proposes a video call to troubleshoot the issue further. **Additional Notes:** * The issue seems to be specific to remote Docker containers. * The workaround involving DNS configuration is complex and may not be suitable for all users. * The patch allowing Pieces Server to listen on all interfaces is the most promising solution. **Concise Summary:** A user reported an issue connecting to Pieces OS from a remote Docker container using the VSCode extension. The problem was identified as a networking change in Pieces OS that prevented connections from loopback addresses. A patch was developed and released in the VSCode extension to fix the issue. However, the user confirmed that the issue persists. A video call was proposed to troubleshoot the issue further.

related_issues.title: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors
related_issues.text: Chrome Extension Fills Developer Console with Errors ### Software Web Extension ### Operating System / Platform macOS ### Your Pieces OS Version 11.0.3 ### Early Access Program - [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature. ### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug. It appears the browser extension is sniffing a bunch of local ports - starting with 1000. This is a bit concerning, and a little invasive, but I do have the Pieces OS running, and it does finally get a response at a high port. This fills my devtools console tab, degrading my development experience by clouding errors I'm looking for in my own app. For a product designed to enhance my development experience I'm marking this as a bug. ## GitHub Issue Summary **Key Points:** * Pieces OS updates made the port for Pieces OS dynamic, requiring checks across different ports. * This resulted in failed calls logged in the dev tool, filling it up with seemingly unnecessary errors. * Hiding or better handling the errors from inactive port checks was requested to avoid cluttering the dev tool. **Problems Identified:** * Failed calls due to changing port for Pieces OS flooded the dev tool with errors. * The issue was perceived as invasive and interfered with the usual debugging process. **Solutions Proposed/Implemented:** * Initially, a fix was planned for the upcoming extension update. * However, the issue was identified as a potential Chrome bug with no clear solution. * As a workaround, users can check the "Hide Network Messages" box in the dev console settings. **Current Status/Outcome:** * The issue is likely caused by a Chrome bug. * No definite fix is available, but users can manually hide network messages in the dev console. * The outcome is suboptimal, but users have a workaround to mitigate the issue.

common_issues.title: Long-Term Memory (LTM) Engine Activation Issues
common_issues.description: Users are experiencing difficulties enabling the Long-Term Memory (LTM) Engine across different operating systems (Windows, macOS, Linux). This is primarily due to issues with LLM state overriding saved data, Qdrant boot failures, and dependency conflicts. The Pieces team is actively working on resolving these issues through patches, database infrastructure updates, and dependency deprecation.

related_issues.title: LTM doesn't work; the copilot model by defaults not saved
related_issues.text:
LTM doesn't work; the copilot model by defaults not saved
### Software

Desktop Application

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.0

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

[https://disk.yandex.ru/i/Z_U0FzYA8NBrNg](url)
There is a video here that describes the problem
## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation

**Key points raised:**

* User reported the Long-Term Memory (LTM) engine wouldn't turn on.
* User shared a video and logs to help diagnose the issue.
* Another user reported the same problem.

**Problems identified:**

* Downloaded LLM state was overriding saved data and preventing LTM engine activation.
* Qdrant was failing to boot on the user's machine, preventing LTM activation.

**Solutions proposed/implemented:**

* A fix was deployed in a patch for the LLM state issue.
* Pieces team is working on updating the database infrastructure to resolve the Qdrant boot issue.

**Current status/outcome:**

* The LLM state issue should be resolved.
* The Qdrant boot issue is still being investigated and a database update is planned to fix it.

**Additional notes:**

* The user reported the issue with the PyCharm plugin crashing.
* The user inquired about a high idle time expense in their system.

**Open questions:**

* Is the Qdrant boot issue impacting all users or just specific configurations?
* What is causing the high idle time expense observed by the user?

## Conclusion

The majority of the reported issues have been addressed or are in the process of being addressed. The user's specific Qdrant boot issue and high idle time expense need further investigation.

related_issues.title: Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
related_issues.text:
Long-Term Memory Feature Not Working on Linux
### Software

Desktop Application, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Linux

### Your Pieces OS Version

11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

### Description
I'm experiencing issues with the Long-Term Memory feature on Linux. While the Discord team has confirmed that this feature should be available on Linux, the Pieces OS interface explicitly shows that the feature is not available for Linux systems.

### Current Behavior
- Pieces OS shows a message indicating Long-Term Memory is not available for Linux
- Long-Term Memory functionality does not work on the Linux platform
- Other operating systems appear to have this feature working correctly

### Expected Behavior
- Long-Term Memory feature should be available and functional on Linux, as confirmed by the Discord team

### Evidence
- [Discord communication confirming feature availability](https://discord.com/channels/1098986658851999776/1320479548797882430/1320643614443048971)

- ![Screenshot showing Pieces OS message about feature unavailability on Linux](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ca6cb2d0-ef52-4194-bd57-c8a84be2d0db)



### Questions
1. When can Linux users expect this feature to be fully available?
2. Is there a planned timeline for Linux support?
3. Are there any workarounds available in the meantime?

### System Information
- Operating System: Linux [Zorin OS 17.2 based on Linux 6.8.0-50-generic~22.04.1-Ubuntu]
- Pieces OS Version: [PiecesOS 11.0.3]
- Desktop App: [Pieces for Developers 3.3.2]

### Additional Notes
This feature is currently working on other operating systems, and Linux users would greatly benefit from having access to this functionality.

## Summary of GitHub Issue Conversation: LTM Engine on Linux

**Key Points Raised:**

* LTM Engine not working on some Linux distros (e.g., Wayland) despite initial testing.
* Michael-Obele and scotch86 report issues and provide logs for analysis.

**Problems Identified:**

* LTM Engine failing to boot up on certain Linux setups due to a dependency issue.

**Solutions Proposed/Implemented:**

* Pieces team is working to deprecate the problematic dependency.
* More comprehensive logs requested from affected users.
* Live troubleshooting session scheduled with Michael-Obele.

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* Issue ongoing, but LTM functionality for Linux is expected in the future.
* Further investigation is needed to identify the root cause and implement a permanent fix.

**Additional Notes:**

* Mark-at-pieces provided a link to a similar issue for reference.

**Overall:**

* The Pieces team is aware of the LTM Engine issues on Linux and actively seeking a solution. They appreciate user feedback and collaboration to resolve the issue effectively.

it seems that live context doesn't work on my linux distro. Try to use it from desktop app, sublime plugin and web extension, but as i ask something even basilar about the context, the copilot does not know nothing.

I read in another issue that running pieces-os as snap app, could be a problem for load other system dependencies. Don't know if this could help.

Don't know which other info could be helpful
##  GitHub Issue Conversation Summary: ##

**Key Points:**

* User `scotch86` reported issues with the Long-Term Memory (LTM) functionality on Ubuntu 24.10 (upgraded from 24.04).
* User couldn't perform basic LTM functionalities like querying past activities or visited pages.
* User provided logs and screenshots for debugging.

**Identified Problems:**

* LTM functionality on Linux was experimental and buggy.
* User interface may not have provided adequate guidance on using LTM effectively.

**Proposed/Implemented Solutions:**

* The LTM issue was acknowledged as a bug on the developer side.
* A fix was targeted for release with EOD in 11.0.3.
* Guidance was offered on prompting the LTM effectively using time range, topics, and applications. 

**Current Status/Outcome:**

* After fixing the bug in 11.0.3, user confirmed the issue persisted.
* Developer suggested better education was needed on using LTM effectively by specifying time frames, topics, and applications.
* It remained unclear if the LTM functionality for Linux users was fully resolved as of January 6th, 2025.

related_issues.title: Pieces OS Does not recognize folders or files
related_issues.text:
Pieces OS Does not recognize folders or files
### Software

Desktop Application, VS Code, Pieces OS

### Operating System / Platform

Windows

### Your Pieces OS Version

PiecesOS 11.0.3

### Early Access Program

- [ ] Yes, this is related to an Early Access Program feature.

### Kindly describe the bug and include as much detail as possible on what you were doing so we can reproduce the bug.

So until about a weekish ago, Everything would work smoothly, except for some other issues that did annoy me, but I had workarounds for them. Those issues was pieces os not working after a while. Not a big deal since I would just close it in task manager and reopen it once it was all closed to force a hard restart of the whole system. But, now (thanks for listening to my little rant up there) there is an issue that I cannot workaround. For some reason pieces cannot get any context from any files or folders, and its getting pretty annoying to the fact that I have started using other softwares because at least they can look at the files and suggest changes or edits that actually have something to do with my code. I believe this happened ever since i updated pieces os about 2-3 updates ago, but cannot pinpoint any specific cause. Another cause may be that fact that I downloaded Ollama but never really used it.
## Key points raised:

* RamanBaig reported that the AI could see file names and recognize relevant code files (e.g., index.html), but it couldn't read file content unless pasted into the chat. This was inconvenient for large files.
* RamanBaig confirmed having Long Term Memory enabled, experiencing the issue with both Claude and GPT models, and having the issue across various project folders.
* RamanBaig used Windows 11 Home, had ~9 files in the folder (4 of which were relevant with thousands of lines of code), and saw only 3 of those relevant files reflected in the "related files" tab.

## Problems identified:

* Limited file content reading - The AI could only read file content if pasted into the chat, limiting its access to large files.
* Difficulty in reproducing - The developer struggled to reproduce the issue, hindering troubleshooting.

## Solutions proposed/implemented:

* The developer suggested scheduling a call with RamanBaig to further investigate the issue.
* The developer mentioned potential changes made that could resolve the problem.

## Current status/outcome:

* A call with RamanBaig was scheduled to diagnose the issue and test potential solutions.
* The developer proposed a call with another collaborator if the original time slot wasn't suitable. 

## Summary:

RamanBaig reported a limitation in file content reading for large files. The developer couldn't reproduce the issue and suggested a call to gather more information and test potential fixes. The current status involves scheduling a call to diagnose the problem and implement a solution.

recommendations: **Prioritize resolving Pieces OS connectivity issues:** This recurring problem causes significant user frustration and impacts various platforms. Focus on stabilizing networking in Pieces OS 11.0.0+ and ensure seamless integration with Docker and VS Code.

**Address Long-Term Memory (LTM) engine activation problems:** This feature is crucial, but users face difficulties across multiple operating systems. Investigate LLM state conflicts, Qdrant boot failures, and dependency issues. Provide clear communication and updates to users regarding LTM stability.

**Improve communication about LTM functionality on Linux:** While LTM is available on Linux, users encounter inconsistencies and error messages. Provide clear documentation and support resources to address Linux-specific LTM challenges.

**Investigate and resolve file content reading limitations:** The Copilot's inability to read large files hinders its functionality. Prioritize resolving this issue to improve code analysis and suggestion capabilities.

**Monitor and address issues related to specific LLM models:** Users report problems with Claude and Gemini models. Investigate these issues, communicate workarounds, and consider promoting more stable models like GPT-4o.
**Proactively monitor forum and Discord for emerging issues:** Identify and address trending issues promptly to prevent widespread impact and improve user experience.
**Consider creating a dedicated troubleshooting guide for common issues:** This resource can empower users to resolve problems independently and reduce support ticket volume.
**Gather detailed logs and system information from users experiencing issues:** This will help developers reproduce and diagnose problems more effectively, leading to faster resolutions.

**Improve error messages and guidance within the Pieces OS interface:** Provide users with clear and actionable information when encountering errors, facilitating self-troubleshooting and reducing confusion.
